title: Recycling: it's everybody's job
brief_description: Garbage - where does it all go? Most of it is burned in incinerators or buried in landfills, which just get bigger and bigger. This video explains and explores recycling, another way to handle the garbage problem. Follow rubbish from household recycling bins through collection to a separation plant, where the different types of materials get sorted. Students will see examples of how a bag of rubbish can be made useful again. Also investigates the usefulness of composting to help with recycling. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.
